Standford Research instrument drivers¶

class pyslave.drivers.standfordresearch.SR830.SR830(resource, *args, **kwargs)¶

StandfordResearch SR830 instrument driver. Direct call to the instrument invokes the outp method.

setFreqSource(source)¶

Function sets teh frequency source to either the internal reference clock, or an external reference.

Parameters:source (string) – {EXTernal|INTernal}
setFreq(freq)¶

Function sers the internal reference frequency. This command only works if the lock-in is set to use the internal reference.

Parameters:freq (float) – Desired frequency. Rounded to 5 digits or 0.0001Hz, whichever is larger.
setPhase(phase)¶

Function sets the phase of the internal reference signal.

Parameters:phase (<-360...+729.99>,float) – Desired phase
setAmplitude(amplitude)¶

Function sets the amplitude of the internal reference signal.

Parameters:amplitude (<0.004...5>,float) – Desired peak-to-peak voltage
setInputGround(grounding)¶

Function sets the input shield grounding to either ‘float’ or ‘ground’

Parameters:grounding ({float|ground},string) – Desired input shield grounding
setInputCoupling(coupling)¶

Function sets the input coupling to either ‘ac’ or ‘dc’

Parameters:coupling ({ac|dc},string) – Desired input coupling mode
setSampleRate(sampleRate)¶

Function sets the data sampling rate of the lock-in

Parameters:sampleRate ({<freq> float,TRIGGER}) – The sampling rate, in Hz as a float, or the string ‘trigger’. When specifying the rate in Hz, acceptable values are integer powers of 2. This means 2^n, n={-4...+9}
setEndOfBufferMode(mode)¶

Function sets the end of buffer mode

Parameters:mode ({1SHOT,LOOP},string) – Desired end of buffer mode
setChannelDisplay(channel, display, ratio)¶

Function sets the display of the two channels. Channel 1 can display X, R, X Noise, Aux In 1, Aux In 2 Channel 2 can display Y, Theta, Y Noise, Aux In 3, Aux In 4

Channel 1 can have ratio of None, Aux In 1, Aux In 2 Channel 2 can have ratio of None, Aux In 3, Aux In 4

Parameters:
  • channel – {CH1|CH2|1|2},string/int
  • display – {X|Y|R|THETA|XNOISE|YNOISE|AUX1|AUX2|AUX3|AUX4},string
  • ratio – {NONE|AUX1|AUX2|AUX3|AUX4},string
setOffsetExpand(mode, offset, expand)¶

Function sets the channel offset and expand parameters. Offset is a percentage, and expand is given as a multiplication factor of 1, 10, or 100.

Parameters:
  • mode ({X|Y|R},sting) – The channel mode that you wish to change.
  • offset (<-105...+105>,float) – Offset of the mode, given as a percent
  • expand ({1|10|100},integer) – Expansion factor for the measurement
autoOffset(mode)¶

Function sets a specific channel mode to auto offset. This is the same as pressing the auto offset key on the display. It sets the offset of the mode specified to zero.

Parameters:mode ({X|Y|R},string) – Mode who’s offset will be set to zero.
autoPhase()¶

Function sets the lock-in to auto phase. This does the same thing as pushing the auto phase button. Do not send this message again without waiting the correct amount of time for the lock-in to finish.

dataTransfer(mode)¶

Function used to turn the data transfer from the lockin on or off

Parameters:mode – {ON|OFF},string
startScan()¶

After setting the data transfer on via the dataTransfer function, this is used to start the scan. The scan starts after a delay of 0.5 seconds.

pause()¶

Has the instrument pause data capture.

init(sampleRate, EoBMode)¶

Wrapper function to prepare the srs830 for measurement. Sets both the data sampling rate and the end of buffer mode

Parameters:
  • sampleRate ({<freq>|TRIGGER}) – The sampling rate in Hz, or the string “trigger”. When specifying the rate in Hz, acceptable values are integer powers of 2. This means 2^n, n={-4...+9}.
  • EoBMode – {1SHOT|LOOP},string
startDataTransfer()¶

Wrapper function to start the actual data transfer. Sets the transfer mode to FAST2, and triggers the data transfer to start after a delay of 0.5 seconds.

dataSnap(mode1, mode2)¶

Function takes a snapshot of the current parameters are defined by variables mode1 and mode2. For combinations (X,Y) and (R,THETA) , they are taken at the same instant. All other combinations are done sequentially, and may not represent values taken from the same timestamp.

Returns a list of floats, arranged in the order that they are given in the function input parameters.

Parameters:mode – {X|Y|R|THETA|AUX1|AUX2|AUX3|AUX4|REF|CH1|CH2},string
outp(mode='x')¶

Read one value. Mode can x, y, r, or theta.

outr(mode='ch1')¶

Read one value. Mode can be ch1 or ch2.

auxv(voltage, aux=1)¶

Set auxiliary output voltage.

readDataBuffer(channel)¶

Function reads the entire data buffer for a specific channel. Transfer is done in ASCII mode. Although binary would be faster, I haven’t yet figured out how to get that to work.

Returns a list of floats containing instrument’s measurements.

Parameters:channel ({CH1|CH2|1|2},string/integer) – Channel data buffer to read from
numDataPoints()¶

Function checks number of data sets in SRS830 buffer. Returns an integer.

clearDataBuffer()¶

Clears the data buffer of the SRS830.
